answers.answer: Why can't they try all the different methods to induce you for a vaginal delivery?
It take 45 minutes all together but the baby will be out in like 10 minutes and the recovery depends on you..
I have high blood pressure. And they also said that shes going to be a really small baby and they think it will cause to much stress on her.
I'm also having a c section on December 17. I was freaking out but also of woman that's had one told it it was great and fast. And the recovery does depend on you. Good luck.
Do they stitch you up or do you have to get staples? Also, will the numbing medicine they give make me be loopy or will I be alert? Im kind of clueless about c-sections.

I believe they stitch you up. and you will be alert. My sister in law was having a c section and her and my brother were having a regular conversation like if nothing was going on. Like I said I've heard a lot of woman love It. My doctor today had one and she said she wouldn't have it any other way.
No need to be going through pain.  You just get there and get your baby out. No complications no pain no nothing.

They did a measurement about a week ago and said that she was 4 pounds 9 ounces. Which I know they could be off big time thats why I wasnt really concerned at first but when I went to the doctor today they acted like she was going to be super small. They are going to check the umbilical cord and everything to make sure shes getting food. They said she only gained about 4 ounces in two weeks and where im so far along she should be gaining half a pound each week.

I was induced at 37 weeks with my first because of preeclampsia and was able to deliver naturally but I was also already 3cm dilated, but there are ways to help with that. My little girl was measuring 2 weeks behind when I had her so depending on the measurements I would ask to try vaginally and if it does put too much stress on her do an emergency c section.
Ok.that makes me feel a little better about it. I just want to know whats going on when my baby gets here.

question: Getting really nervous now.I went to my doctor today and I go back on Thursday and friday to get measurements of my baby.she was measuring small so they want to induce me at 37 weeks which is next week. They told me that when they check my cervix on friday if im not dilated some then ill be getting a c section. From the way she talked shes expecting me to have to get a c-section. Im extremely nervous now that its so close. How long does a c-section take and how is the recovery process? Im terrified of having to be cut.
title: c section
